subsection.name: Overview
subsection.p: You can delete data from PDS Registry (Elasticsearch) with Registry Manager command-line tool.

ul.li: Registry Manager command-line tool is installed.

subsection.name: Delete Data
subsection.p:
You can delete metadata by lidvid, lid, package id (Harvest job id), or delete all data. Few examples are shown below.
Delete by LIDVID
registry-manager delete-data \ -lidvid urn:nasa:pds:context:target:asteroid.4_vesta::1.1 \ -es https://my-server.my-domain.com:9999 \ -index registry \ -auth path/to/auth.cfg
NOTE: "-es" (Elasticsearch URL), "-index" (Elasticsearch index name), and "-auth" (authentication file) parameters are optional. Default Elasticsearch URL is "http://localhost:9200".
If your Elasticsearch server requires authentication, you have to create an authentication configuration file and provide following parameters:
# true - trust self-signed certificates; false - don't trust. trust.self-signed = true user = pds-user1 password = mypassword
Delete by LID
registry-manager delete-data \ -lid urn:nasa:pds:context:target:asteroid.4_vesta -es http://localhost:9200
Delete by Package / Job ID
registry-manager delete-data \ -packageId 8d8ae96d-044e-473d-a278-62635b1c5977
Delete all Data
registry-manager delete-data -all -index test1

subsection.name: Elasticsearch API
subsection.p: You can also use Elasticsearch delete by query API.
